The AEK-972 is a 5.56x45mm version of the AEK-971. It is compatible with the various magazines of the AK-100 rifle family such as the AK-101, AK-102 carbine and AK-108. Its purpose of being an export for Western Countries came short in The Zone, for some expensive black markets were able to acquire this variant and sell it around.

 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] EKP-8-02 Kobra, 1P29, PSO-1 scopes
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] TGP-A suppressor
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] GP-25 grenade launcher

The A-545 is a successor of the AEK-971 that saw limited service in the Russian Army, making it very rare even in The Zone. Other than its subtle improvements, which includes a more compact yet ergonomic sliding stock, a rotatory rear drum aperture sight and a two-round burst instead of three, the most obvious would be the lack of a dovetail mount in favour of a Picatinny rail, allowing it to use NATO scopes.

Changing of the muzzle allows the gun to attach a silencer, but also slightly reduces fire-rate, accuracy and reliability overall.
Restores the prototype cyclic rate back to 1500 RPM, but also decreases reliability.
Installs a very heavy recoil buffer, heavily reducing recoil but also adding a lot of weight and reducing RPM.
Custom cyclic system lets the gun fire at 1600 RPM on the first three rounds.
